column4: Hey, i install 10.04, then ran updates, and i guess the kernel got updated, so now on my grub boot menu i have 2 versions of the kernal along side windows....how cn i clean up the bootmenu?
you want at least 2 kernel sets, backup kernel is the standard method
yes but I forget how to do it, but having that stuff gone may not be a good idea
startup manager is okay but additional kernesl will move and the line start wont
